intro: Cleistanthus pierrei, commonly known as the Malayan cleistanthus, is a small evergreen tree native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers. The plant produces capsules as its fruit, which contain seeds covered in a sticky, resinous substance. It thrives in tropical rainforests and is often found in secondary growth areas. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
